column4: anyone know what ubuntu's schedule is for pulling stuff from debian?  I'm wondering if the recently released alsa-1.0.8 has a chance of making it into hoary.
it will sync when the devs have time.
because it's a ubuntu merge, it requires manual adjustment.
which chipset?
it's a Sound Blaster Audigy -- I don't know the chipset (not much of a hardware guy -- just want to listen to tunes ;-))
that was actually supported way back in 1.0.4
it is supported.
really?  what do I have to do -- my system doesn't detect the card.
could it be the Audigy LS is different from some other Audigy?
extremely different.
it's crippled hardware, per creative's usual marketing tactics.
you need 1.0.6 or newer with the ca0106 driver.
but for stable functionality, you need 1.0.7 or newer.
perhaps a silly question, but is there any way to get ubuntu to auto detect it?
no, because it's not currently enabled for Hoary.
ok
any tips on how to go about getting it working?  will I need to compile a new kernel, etc...?
no, you need to compile a alsa-modules deb
sudo aptitude install alsa-source build-essential kernel-package linux-headers-$(uname -r); more /usr/share/doc/alsa-source/README.Debian
thanks a bunch
'apache-utils'
note it's for 1.3.x
